message.content:
There are several ways to professionally sign off an email, depending on the tone and level of formality. Here are some examples:

1. Sincerely: A widely-used formal sign-off for emails, ideal for professional or serious contexts.
2. Kind regards/Best regards: A more casual but still respectful option, suitable for most business correspondence.
3. Yours faithfully: Suitable when addressing someone you don't know well in a formal context.
4. Yours sincerely/Yours truly: Works well when you have established rapport with the recipient during previous communications.
5. Best/All the best: A friendly closing that works well in informal settings or between colleagues who know each other well.

Depending on your relationship with the recipient, you may choose different phrases to convey various sentiments at the end of your message before signing off:

- Warmest wishes
- Thanks and have a great day
- Looking forward to hearing from you

Remember to include your name (and job title if applicable) after whichever sign-off phrase you choose!
